basics.name: Nick Noble
basics.label: Design++
basics.summary:
Huge nerd, specializing in being a generalist – I’ve been a waiter, designer, coder, fry cook, advisor, graphic artist, manager, taste-tester, speaker, sculpter, printer, actor, furniture mover, high school teacher, and just about everything in between. All of these jobs have one thing in common: an absurd amount of extra steps between you and what you woke up for.

Now I’m on a personal mission: reduce the work between the work, wherever I can.

I’m highly passionate about teaching, especially when it comes to helping others create better. That means collaboration, organizational design, and generally “how do people / groups get things out of their brain and into the world?” are things I think about every day.

work.name: Thesis
work.summary:
• Leading post-acquisition reorganization of all teams within Barrington Media (acquired @Thesis in 2021). Driving alignment between C-Suite & departmental leadership to develop a scalable operating model.
• Maintaining the roadmap for internal projects including rebranding, content marketing, core technology, new processes, and major changes.
• Designing and developing internal tools for tracking KPIs and mapping structural and collaborative relationships across orgs.
• Building and refining teams for optimal outcomes, employee retention, and team compatibility, including cross-functional manager training, onboarding staff, and dynamic reteaming.

work.name: Thesis
work.summary:
• Spearheaded the creation of a highly strategic Studio Services vertical, taking social creative & content production from 0 to 1. Hand selected and recruited all staff, oversaw the acquisition and build out of a physical video production space. 
• Scaled the team by 3x by recruiting, training, and mentoring top video, design, and operational talent from associate to director levels.
• Devised, implemented, documented, and maintained more scalable and repeatable processes across studio, post production, UGC, and design — including the procurement and onboarding of Frame.io, drastically increasing efficiency and effectiveness of collaboration for remote video and creative teams.
• Launched content marketing initiatives including a new blog property, instagram, and video content. 
• Maintained the highest staff retention rate at the company, including reports of reports.
• Instilled a culture of data + critique driven iteration, ensuring teams and individual designers and creatives kept standards elevated.
• Published transparent career paths and skills matrices for every role across my department.
• Held monthly 1:1s with every member of the department.
• Spearheaded a company wide reorganization into cross-functional, agile teams. Wrote documentation, trained management, and built teams.

work.name: Thesis
work.summary:
• Led the Design team, scaled headcount by 5x and output by ~20x. 
• Developed methods for creating and maintaining 50+ design systems at scale.
• Facilitated and implemented company-wide cross training programs for all Thesis staff, with a focus on new employees. This included lunch & learns, 30/60/90 development plans, training on essential workplace tools such as Notion, and technical onboarding for proprietary platforms and frameworks.
• Pioneered and launched a more inclusive hiring process for design, by removing barriers such as educational requirements or portfolios at the application stage, to broaden opportunities for a wider range of skill-based talent.

work.name: Thesis
work.summary:
• Collaborated with Engineering and CRO functions to create improved project management processes, with more accurate measurement of KPIs for velocity, quality, and capacity.
• Built or bought tools that drastically increased design efficiency and quality, while reducing cost by thousands of dollars per month, such as migrating the team to Figma.
• Document and democratized processes, championing autonomy, high standards, and accessibility for designers and those who interacted with design.

work.name: Thesis
work.summary:
• Founding member of the engineering team. Architected Thesis core technology including the Thesis Pattern Library (landing page layout, variation, and brand layer), and Thesis Form (core quiz & survey engine). 
• Automated the creation of new client applications, saving days per instance.
• Codified and automated aspects of the Thesis employee onboarding process, including the setup and securing of employee machines, walking through documentation and codebases, and .
• Built and scaled teams including Infra (formed from existing team members) and Engineering (hired and scaled team from 4 to 16 headcount in 7 months).
• Defined and configured core DevOps processes including code review, CI, hosting (Heroku, Vercel)

references.name: William Mitchell
references.reference: Nick Noble steps into any situation with confidence. He is not only highly technically qualified but also he holds a deep knowledge of design. I’ve seen him carve his own path in the industry teaching himself the skills needed to succeed and grow. He’s a smart charming character who isn’t afraid to say it how it is.
